tit.e: Kosho (康正) (a busshi (sculptor of Buddhist Statues))

sen.j: 康正（こうしょう、1534年-1621年）は、安土桃山時代から江戸時代初期の仏師。
sen.e: Born in 1534 and gone in 1621, Kosho [康正] was a busshi living from the Azuchi-momoyama period to the early Edo period.

He was the twenty-first heir of "Kei school" (one of the sculptor schools of Buddhist statues).

sen.j: 豊臣秀吉の命で七条仏所の地を時宗の金光寺に寄進、四条烏丸へ移転。
sen.e: Under the order of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, Kosho dedicated "Shichijo bussho" (a Buddhist sculpture workshop at Shichijo) to Konko-ji Temple of Ji Sect, and Kosho moved his workshop to Shijo-Karasuma.
